result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J Salaam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs, DNA and Buy Money to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Buy Money to be forwarded to Waukesha Co. Drug Metro Unit.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to a AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
If Defendant completes his entire sentence with no new violations/or violations. Court finds Society will not be harmed and will grant expungement.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (nonworking hours) STAYED -  To be used at Agent's discretion, as well as to the huber/straight time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey J Salaam in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Buy Money of $400.00 to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 DNA, surcharge is waived.
 - 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/straight time at the Agent's discretion. 

Defense requests expungement
If defendant completes his entire sentence with no violations and has no new violations, Court will find that society will not be harmed and grant expungement.
Sentencing hearing on April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Corey J Salaam in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. Court orders a Presentence Investigation to be compiled and filed within 30 days. Court will set a sentencing hearing in 45 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
